command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Hunt the Flag". Some players prefer the name "VIP" for this mode.

variableArgument.description: The name of the map you wish to play

section.name: Editing configs
section.description: All the below commands are used specifically in map configuration files. Some of these commands can also be used without the need of a map configuration file.

command.name: mdltrans
command.description: translates (= moves) the model

command.name: isolatecontext
command.description: Isolates the given context. This disables access from this context to identifiers located in other contexts, also it removes all aliases created in this context once the running context changes

command.name: sealcontexts
command.description: secure this configuration for the rest of the game

command.name: fog
command.description: Sets the fog distance.

remarks.remark: You can do this for tweaking the visual effect of the fog, or if you are on a slow machine, setting the fog to a low value can also be a very effective way to increase fps (if you are geometry limited). Try out different values on big maps / maps which give you low fps. It is also good for aesthetic features of maps especially when combined with "fogcolour".

command.name: fogcolour
command.description: Sets the fog and clearing colour.

command.name: loadnotexture
command.description: Binds a texture to be used if a slot couldn't be loaded with a given textures path.

remarks.remark: Binds the texture indicated in the filename to the texture slot of any textures that aren't found. The path is given exactly as with the texture-command, if it is omitted (or can't be loaded) the default is used. The default is located in packages/misc/notexture.jpg (not in packages/textures - where custom ones must reside!)

example.code: loadnotexture "makke/black.jpg" // Any missing texture will show up black

argument.description: file name of the texture to bind

command.name: loadsky
command.description: Loads a skymap for a map.

remarks.remark: The available skymaps reside in packages/textures/skymaps/..
To select a skymap you need to use the full path from "packages/" but only up to the underscore "_" in the filename.

argument.description: path to the six skybox textures

command.name: mapmodel
command.description: Registers a mapmodel that can be placed in maps.

remarks.remark: A mapmodel registered with this command can be placed in a map using the 'newent mapmodel' command. The bounding box is an invisible force surrounding the model, allowing players to collide against it, instead of walking through the mapmodel. For more information about this command, read mapediting5.xml.
Example: mapmodel 4 2 4 0 "modelname"
This mapmodel has a bounding box of 8x8x2 in size (X/Y/Z) and by default hovers 4 units above ground.

argument.description: The square radius of the bounding box.
The height of the bounding box.
The initial height offset from the ground.
This integer is redundant. Leave it at zero so you don't break the command.
The name of the map model

command.name: mapmodelreset
command.description: Resets the mapmodel slots/indices to 0 for the subsequent "mapmodel" commands.

remarks.remark: Each subsequent mapmodel command increases it again. See config/default_map_settings.cfg for an example.

command.name: mapsound
command.description: Defines a mapsound.

remarks.remark: Registers the sound as a map-specific sound. These map-specific sounds may currently only be used with "sound" entities within a map. The first map sound registered in a map has slot/index number 0 and increases afterwards.

command.name: mapsoundreset
command.description: Resets the mapsound slots/indices to 0 for the subsequent "mapsound" commands.

remarks.remark: Each subsequent mapsound command increases it again. See config/default_map_settings.cfg for an example.

command.name: shadowyaw
command.description: Shadow yaw specifies the angle at which shadow stencils are drawn on a map.

remarks.remark: When specifying shadowyaw, remember that the default angle is 45 degrees. The example below would make the shadows appear at 90 degrees (45 degrees more to the left).

argument.description: The angle in degrees to rotate the stencil shadows

command.name: texture
command.description: Binds a texture to the current texture slot.

remarks.remark: Binds the texture indicated in the filename to the current texture slot and increments the slot number.

argument.description: This is a redundant value. Always leave this value as 0 here so it doesn'tbreak your configurations.
File name of the texture to bind

command.name: texturereset
command.description: Sets the texture slots/indicies to 0 for the subsequent "texture" commands.

remarks.remark: Each subsequent texture command increases it again. See config/default_map_settings.cfg for an example.

command.name: watercolour
command.description: Determines the water colour in a map.

remarks.remark: You must define all 3 values, otherwise this command may not work correctly (use "1" as a placeholder if needed).

section.name: TODO
section.description: This section describes identifiers that are not documented yet, but you may try to help us there.

scriptalias.name: onDeathOther
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time anybody but yourself dies.

scriptalias.name: onDeathSelf
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time you yourself die.

scriptalias.name: onSpawnOther
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time anybody but yourself spawns.

scriptalias.name: onSpawnSelf
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time you yourself spawn.

scriptalias.name: onCallVote
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time a vote is called.

scriptalias.name: onChangeVote
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time a vote is changed.

command.name: getposition
command.description: Get information about your place in the world. Dimension: 0123 => XYZ and yaw

variable.name: positiontype
variable.description: 0: int, 1: float

command.name: strlen
command.description: length of string S

command.name: l0
command.description: leading zeros for the number V to make it W chars wide

command.name: getdemonameformat
command.description: returns the currently used formatstring for demo filenames

command.name: getdemotimeformat
command.description: returns the currently used formatstring for demo timestamp

command.name: demonameformat
command.description: set the formatstring for demo filenames - default: TODO (when stable)

remarks.remark: we use the following internal mapping of formatchars:
%g : gamemode (int) %G : gamemode (chr) %F : gamemode (full)
%m : minutes remaining %M : minutes played
%s : seconds remaining %S : seconds played
%h : IP of server %H : hostname of server (%N : title of server (really???))
%n : mapName
%w : timestamp "when"

command.name: demotimeformat
command.description: set the formatstring for demo timestamp - default: TODO (when stable)

remarks.remark: same as strftime() - see http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/clibrary/ctime/strftime/ for details

variable.name: demotimelocal
variable.description: use localtime (1) or GMT (0)?

variable.name: popdeadplayers
variable.description: make dead players instantly pop out of existence, instead of falling over and sinking into the ground.

command.name: addzip
command.description: TODO: Description

command.name: checkmapdependencies
command.description: Find what media the map depends on, this is used for mediapack providers.

command.name: findcn
command.description: find client number (cn)

command.name: findpn
command.description: find player name

command.name: fontskip
command.description: At what char does the definition proceed?

command.name: gettext
command.description: An alias used for i18n. Translateable text should be marked [(_ "this is the EN-us variant of the text")].

command.name: mapshot
command.description: save an image of the entire radar-overview of the map.

command.name: menufont
command.description: switch the font in which the menu is displayed

command.name: menucanblink
command.description: for toggling on the ability for menutext to have the blinking bit set. The global setting of 'allowblinkingtext' overrides this

command.name: allowblinkingtext
command.description: for toggling on the ability for any text to have the blinking bit set.

command.name: menuitemmapload
command.description: a menuitem that loads a map, displays the title and the preview or a default image

command.name: musicpreload
command.description: TODO: Description

command.name: quicknadethrow
command.description: TODO: Description

command.name: removezip
command.description: TODO: Description

command.name: setburst
command.description: TODO: Description

command.name: setwptriggernr
command.description: TODO: Description

command.name: soundmuted
command.description: TODO: Description

variable.name: akimboendaction
variable.description: 0: none, 1: switch to primary?, 2: switch to nades?-before-switch to primary?

variable.name: ambient
variable.description: TODO

variable.name: applydialog
variable.description: do you reall want to quit?

variable.name: autoscopesens
variable.description: TODO

variable.name: cncolumncolor
variable.description: colour of CN column in scoreboard

variable.name: damagescreen
variable.description: show the blood-spat overlay when receiving damage?

variable.name: damagescreenalpha
variable.description: if overlay of blood-spat, at what blending (transparency) level?

variable.name: damagescreenfactor
variable.description: if overlay of blood-spat, use which factor

variable.name: damagescreenfade
variable.description: if overlay of blood-spat, at what speed does it fade

variable.name: hudextras
variable.description: TODO

variable.name: interms
variable.description: TODO

variable.description: TODO

variable.description: TODO

variable.name: mdldlist

variable.description: TODO

variable.description: TODO

variable.name: scorefont
variable.description: use monspacefont to render the scoreboard? or the default one?

variable.name: sensitivityscale
variable.description: TODO

variable.name: testvel
variable.description: TODO

variable.name: texturescale
variable.description: TODO

variable.name: voicecomsounds
variable.description: TODO

variable.name: maploaditemlength
variable.description: change at what position to truncate the map title string

variable.name: showmapbackdrop
variable.description: change wether to have a see-through map overview (0), or render it on a black backdrop (1) or a combination of both (2)

variable.name: radarheight
variable.description: change at what height you are floating in the radar-view

command.name: showedithide
command.description: shows the settings of edithide (sparklies)

command.name: setedithide
command.description: hides the list of entity types you set. pass 1 for light, 2 for spawn, or use "playerstart".

remarks.remark: pass light or 1, playerstart or 2. Call [setedithide 1 10] to just hide all lights and mapmodels.
Or [setedithide [3 4 5 6 7 8 9 12 13]] for all the clips, ammo, nades, health, helmet, armour, akimbo, ladder, and flag.
Reversly just use [1 2 10 11 13 14 15 16] to hide light, spawn, mapmodel, ladder, sound, clip, plclip.
Only shown entity types are potential 'closest entity'.

command.name: seteditshow
command.description: hides all but the single entity type you give. pass 1 for light, 2 for spawn, or use [playerstart].

remarks.remark: Just run [seteditshow model] and see just the model entities.
The other entity types are ignored as closestentity too.
other call forms may use the numerical item type
